Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: lovesouth42
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews we booked a 4 night stay at this place. It ruined our stay in beautiful Istanbul. On arrival, no rooms were available, so we got a "garden room" in the basement for 1 night with a 10 Euro pice reduction, and a promise that we will be transfered upstairs to a " nice room" the following day. The garden room had a bathroom and a toilet in the same space, the showerhead placed above the toilet so while we showered the toilet got cleaned as well. The room had a bed and nothing more. No table, no night stand, no lamps. The hotel, the rooms need a major cleaning. We were hopeful that our nice room will be nice. Wrong. The paint was peeling off the ceiling falling on the bed and on our clothes. The breakfast was the same every morning. No juices or fruit. Bread with some small packages of butter, jam, cream cheese and a miserable coffee. After this review I am erasing this experience from my memory.

Reviews.Title: “Great for small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: merchy10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nayla from Dec 27th to 29th and enjoyed my stay. The hotel owner Qadeer is very helpful and speaks fluent english which really helps. He guided us on places to eat and how to schedule our day. We had the family room which had a double and two single beds. I was traveling with wife and two little kids. Its a small room which only has room for a couple suitcases but was just enough for us. We were literally 5 mins walk from Blue Mosque and maybe 10 mins from other tourist stuff in Sultanahmet. The hotel doesnt have an elevator so not recommended for elderly that can't climb stairs. Breakfast on roof top was decent (bread, boiled egg and milk). If you are looking for a decent hotel close to attractions, I'd definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travel!”
Reviews.Author: BeeAndKay
Reviews.Content: After lots of research we chose to stay at the Nayla Palace. It's exactly what we were looking for: budget prices, great location, clean rooms, good sleep. It was VERY helpful that the owner spoke perfect English too. Our room had a private bathroom en suite and I was surprised at how comfortable the bed was. We slept great! We had a hot-pot in the room to heat up water (we brought our own instant starbucks coffee). The owner loaned me a hair-dryer so I wouldn't have to pack my own (THANKS!!!). The breakfast was great! A boiled egg, fruit, tomato, cheese and lots of bread and coffee or tea (choose the tea!). We loved it! The breakfast lady was wonderful. We really liked the location as we could walk everywhere and got a lot of exercise while there (we lost 15 lbs between the two of us!). There was public transportation nearby as well. The owner arranged airport transport for us the day we flew to Ankara. We would definitely stay here again as the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “a nice place and nice people in the center of the historical city”
Reviews.Author: claudeFlayoscFrance
Reviews.Content: Small bedroom and a very very smal bathroom but very quet at night and a splendid place to have breakfast with a view on the Bosphorus in the morning.. Gorgeous view ! Always someone present to help and give an advice. Luckily the boss speaks a perfect american (but his turkish is un understandable ...for me !) In the morning you can hear the muezzin from the Blue Mosque answering with the one of Aya Sofia. If you are not interested in international luxury and prefer real local life, do not hesitate. a couple of french people on a week's holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, excellent tourist location.”
Reviews.Author: cphillips35805
Reviews.Content: Brother and sister run pension. Both were incredibly nice and patient with us. The other guests were mostly families or older couples traveling, no wild party people. My Mom and I travelled together in Turkey and this was our first stop. We unfortunately found quite a bit of mold in our bathroom which created a slight smell, but we were given the option to move into a different room. Given everything and the prices of other hotels/pensions in the area, I recommend (not highly recommend, just recommend) this pension.

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts, great location”
Reviews.Author: rosey10
Reviews.Content: This hotel / pension is in a great location - just a few minutes walk to all of the main sights in Sultanahmet, but one street away from the busy (and not so nice) backpacker's street. The rooms were cute, and they obviously make an attempt to keep them as up to date as possible on a limited budget. The hosts are really helpful, and the breakfast on the terrace is brilliant - they make sure you have enough to eat, and the views over the Sea of Marmara make it difficult to want to leave the hotel. Definitely recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirlSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend and I wasn't disappointed. It's just a few minutes walk from all of the main attractions, but in a quiet street. The owner was always happy to sit and have a chat and share his knowledge of Turkey with me. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the terrace was a great place to hang out. I felt like I had come to stay with a family rather than a hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “feel like at home”
Reviews.Author: Zdenka37
Reviews.Content: We stayed there five days and they cleaned rubbish every day and once they even changed the linen and towels. Rooms aren't big but anyway we needed it just for sleeping and beds are really comfortable. Bathroom would appreciate some improvments.

HotelInfo.Name: Nayla Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Kutlugun Sokak. No:22 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul, Turkey
